As an integral part of the clinical care team, the Patient Care Associate is responsible for patient care and support activities promoting patient focused care within the Specialty Service. * Maintains a safe, clean and functional environment, including removing trash and bringing physical plant and equipment problems to the attention of the managers.
* Transports patients to stretchers or wheelchairs, as required

* Certificate of completion of a medical assistant/patient care assistant with skills in venipuncture and EKG

A nurse practitioner (NP) as described in Title VIII, Article 139 section 6910 of the New York Education Law is a RN who has earned a separate certification as an NP through advanced clinical nursing education in a distinct specialty area of practice. Nurse practitioners are independent practitioners who diagnose, treat, and prescribe for a patients condition that falls within their specialty area of practice.



NOTE: Medical orders, progress notes and treatments plans are not required to be countersigned by a physician.


**PRINCIPLES DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES**


**CLINICAL PRACTICE**


* Assesses the health status of patients/families by means of comprehensive health history and physical examination.
* Initiates and orders selected therapeutic and diagnostic procedures, consultations and laboratory examination, prescribes medication regimens, interprets findings and alters plan of care according to accepted standards of care and practice guidelines
* Educates and counsels in the areas of health promotion, maintenance, disease prevention, and management of acute/chronic illnesses.
* Documents findings and plan of care in the patient's medical record.
* Consults with physician according to established standards, policies, procedures, and protocols.
* Demonstrates the knowledge and skills necessary to provide care, based on physical, psychosocial, educational, safety, and related criteria, appropriate to the age of the patients served in assigned area.
* Initiates referrals to specialty services and fosters continuity of care.
* Participates in team meetings and conferences to enhance an interdisciplinary approach to care delivery.
* Maintains patient/employee confidentiality in the management of information.
* Develops the plan of care based on the diagnoses and individual patient needs, records, reports, and interprets the clients’ responses to the plan of care.
* Performs a patient record review with the collaborating physician in a timely fashion but not less than every three months if utilizing a collaborative practice agreement.
* Completes the Focused Professional Practice Proctoring Evaluation (FPPE) or the Ongoing Professional Practice Proctoring Evaluation (OPPE) as required by Medical Staff for continued credentialing status.
* Practices as a member of the allied health staff according to the rules and regulations of the Medical Staff and the bylaws of the Hospital Staff.


**PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT**


* Supports the mission, vision, philosophy and goals of the Department of Nursing and the MSHS.
* Demonstrates accountability for own nursing practice.
* Advocates for patients/families and supports patients' rights.
* Considers ethical issues of professional nursing practice and adheres to the code of ethics.
* Demonstrates a humanistic, kind, and caring attitude in the delivery of health care.
* Serves as a resource person to nurses and other health team members.
* Participates in peer review.
* Incorporates research findings in clinical practice.
* Participates in approved nursing and medical research studies.
* Keeps knowledge current by self-directed learning, literature review and attendance at educational programs.
* Participates in defining, maintaining, and interpreting standards of nursing practice.
* Contributes to the maintenance of a positive image of advanced practice nursing in the medical center and in the local community by implementing programs which recognize nursing as a profession.
* Participates in departmental and interdisciplinary committees which influence and/or determine policies affecting nursing practice and patient care delivery.
* Seeks opportunities to enhance professional nursing practice and influences outcomes.
* Treats co-workers, patients and families with dignity and respect.
* Is open and responsive to the diverse backgrounds and experience of other people, and promotes an environment that is sensitive to cultural diversity.


**KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES REQUIRED**


* Ability to perform history taking.
* Ability to perform physical assessment techniques.
* Demonstrate and complete documentation of competency in specialty specific procedures according to established standards as part of initial orientation and annual performance review with collaborating physician or appropriately credentialed designee.
* Ability to interpret and apply principles of nursing research utilization.

* Work within a Collaborative Practice Agreement or Collaborative Practice Relationship Attestation as a member of the health care team in area of practice

**Description** **Job Title - Nurse Practitioner-Medicine Admin-Mount Sinai Hospital-Full Time -Day - Grant Funded**



A nurse practitioner (NP) as described in Title VIII, Article 139 section 6910 of the New York Education Law is a RN who has earned a separate certification as an NP through advanced clinical nursing education in a distinct specialty area of practice. Nurse practitioners are independent practitioners who diagnose, treat, and prescribe for a patients condition that falls within their specialty area of practice.



NOTE: Medical orders, progress notes and treatments plans are not required to be countersigned by a physician.


**PRINCIPLES DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES**


**CLINICAL PRACTICE**


* Assesses the health status of patients/families by means of comprehensive health history and physical examination.
* Initiates and orders selected therapeutic and diagnostic procedures, consultations and laboratory examination, prescribes medication regimens, interprets findings and alters plan of care according to accepted standards of care and practice guidelines
* Educates and counsels in the areas of health promotion, maintenance, disease prevention, and management of acute/chronic illnesses.
* Documents findings and plan of care in the patient's medical record.
* Consults with physician according to established standards, policies, procedures, and protocols.
* Demonstrates the knowledge and skills necessary to provide care, based on physical, psychosocial, educational, safety, and related criteria, appropriate to the age of the patients served in assigned area.
* Initiates referrals to specialty services and fosters continuity of care.
* Participates in team meetings and conferences to enhance an interdisciplinary approach to care delivery.
* Maintains patient/employee confidentiality in the management of information.
* Develops the plan of care based on the diagnoses and individual patient needs, records, reports, and interprets the clients’ responses to the plan of care.
* Performs a patient record review with the collaborating physician in a timely fashion but not less than every three months if utilizing a collaborative practice agreement.
* Completes the Focused Professional Practice Proctoring Evaluation (FPPE) or the Ongoing Professional Practice Proctoring Evaluation (OPPE) as required by Medical Staff for continued credentialing status.
* Practices as a member of the allied health staff according to the rules and regulations of the Medical Staff and the bylaws of the Hospital Staff.


**PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT**


* Supports the mission, vision, philosophy and goals of the Department of Nursing and the MSHS.
* Demonstrates accountability for own nursing practice.
* Advocates for patients/families and supports patients' rights.
* Considers ethical issues of professional nursing practice and adheres to the code of ethics.
* Demonstrates a humanistic, kind, and caring attitude in the delivery of health care.
* Serves as a resource person to nurses and other health team members.
* Participates in peer review.
* Incorporates research findings in clinical practice.
* Participates in approved nursing and medical research studies.
* Keeps knowledge current by self-directed learning, literature review and attendance at educational programs.
* Participates in defining, maintaining, and interpreting standards of nursing practice.
* Contributes to the maintenance of a positive image of advanced practice nursing in the medical center and in the local community by implementing programs which recognize nursing as a profession.
* Participates in departmental and interdisciplinary committees which influence and/or determine policies affecting nursing practice and patient care delivery.
* Seeks opportunities to enhance professional nursing practice and influences outcomes.
* Treats co-workers, patients and families with dignity and respect.
* Is open and responsive to the diverse backgrounds and experience of other people, and promotes an environment that is sensitive to cultural diversity.


**KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES REQUIRED**


* Ability to perform history taking.
* Ability to perform physical assessment techniques.
* Demonstrate and complete documentation of competency in specialty specific procedures according to established standards as part of initial orientation and annual performance review with collaborating physician or appropriately credentialed designee.

* Checks expiration dates on all medications and medical supplies disposing appropriately as per institution policy.
* Maintains a safe, secure, and healthy work environment by following standards and procedures; complies with legal regulations.

* Performs other duties as assigned.

* Certification as a Medical Assistant from an approved school

description:
**Portfolio Manager - Infectious & Endocrine Disorders**
========================================================

**Employer:** EUROIMMUN US, Inc.

**Location:** 1 Bloomfield Avenue, Mountain Lakes, NJ 07046

**Hours:** M-F, 40 hours/week


EUROIMMUN US (a Revvity Company) is one of the leading manufacturers of medical laboratory diagnostics worldwide. EUROIMMUN stands for innovation and is dedicated to improving the science of diagnostics and people's lives worldwide. Our extensive product portfolio and innovative technologies are designed to provide quick, accurate, and reliable diagnoses. More than 3,300 employees in 17 countries develop, produce, and sell test systems to support the diagnosis of diseases, as well as software and automation solutions for the performance and evaluation of these tests. Laboratories in over 140 countries use our assays and automation for autoimmune, infectious disease, allergy, antigen, and molecular testing. EUROIMMUN U.S. proudly prioritizes a people-centered culture, securing a spot among New Jersey's 2023 Top Places to Work.

 **Overivew:**


EUROIMMUN US is seeking a Portfolio Manager, Infectious & Endocrine Disorders. This position assumes responsibility for developing and implementing strategies to grow the assigned portfolio. Working alongside cross-functional teams in R&D and commercial, this position will guide your success with these critical product lines, leading all aspects of product development, focusing on key product requirements, and supporting market analysis, planning, and commercial strategy. Key success metrics of this position are financial growth, portfolio profitability, customer allegiance scores, new product introductions, and improvement in brand position for the overall portfolio. The position requires significant thought leadership, strategic organizational change skills, and the ability to influence across a wide variety of functions/roles.

**Essential Functions:**

* Manage new and existing products in the portfolio by creating product marketing plans including but not limited to go-to-market plans, sales promotion strategies, product launch strategies, communication plans, pricing strategies, etc.
* Draft and create a positioning framework for products by conducting thorough market research, competitive intelligence, and healthcare demands. Ensure product-market fit for existing and novel products. Provide appropriate feedback if otherwise.
* Develop product requirements documents for novel product launches or existing portfolio expansion.
* Stay abreast of diagnostic guideline changes and competition new product releases and update business cases and planned strategies.
* Create a Gap Analysis Framework by conducting a thorough analysis of customer’s needs & requirements, for existing and novel products. Provide solutions to mitigate commercial needs to accelerate market adoption for the portfolio.
* Own customer concerns/issue regarding portfolio and raise them to appropriate internal teams.
* Proactively monitor/benchmark key developments of competitors to provide early warning for potential threats and opportunities for successful implementation of prioritized critical initiatives and tactical plans.
* Coalesce with the marketing communication teams to design and develop customer-facing marketing resources (flyers, brochures, presentations, videos, blogs, social media content, etc.) that are compliant with the regulatory standards.
* Ensure close coordination with peers and key matrix partners including the scientific, commercial, and regulatory teams to develop product lifecycle management plans and frameworks.
* Draft business plans/cases for the long-term product roadmap that fulfills healthcare advances, diagnostic guideline changes, and competition advancement reflecting the company’s business models, pricing strategies, and workflow requirements.

**Basic Qualifications:**

* Bachelor’s degree in in relevant medical science area, marketing, or business AND
* A minimum of five years of developing strategy in product management, commercial sales, or marketing role.
* A minimum of two years’ experience in diagnostics or life sciences industry.
* Travel requirements: To capture the voice of customers and feedback, frequent travel will be required, which includes travel to customer sites and tradeshows. This may include up to 5 days/month.

**Preferred Qualifications:**

* Master’s degree in relevant medical science area, marketing, or business.
* Ph.D., or M.B.A. strongly preferred.
* Experience demonstrating innovative marketing strategies in a competitive marketplace.
* Relevant diagnostic IVD experience is strongly preferred.
* Experience developing strategy and successfully driving operational-related goals around product management required
* Experience in marketing in a scientific environment will offer additional success in this role.
* US Market experience with launch and product lifecycle stages experience is preferred.

**Knowledge, Skills, Abilities:**

* Seeking a highly motivated individual who can work with a high degree of autonomy, in a dynamic environment applying creative problem-solving skills and industry knowledge.
* Ability to plan, implement, and measure with a strong desire to achieve desired results.
* Ability to be successful in a highly matrix environment.
* Ability to see new business opportunities, set and meet bold objectives, and develop strong working relationships will be required for success.
* Ability to lead, driving project scope, budget, and schedule to achieve timely completion of project requirements.

description:
Introduction:

Since 1973, East West Bank has served as a pathway to success. With over 120 locations across the U.S. and Asia, we are the premier financial bridge between the East and West. Our teams of experienced, multi-cultural professionals help guide businesses and community members on both sides of the Pacific looking to explore new markets and create new opportunities, and our sustained growth and expertise in industries like real estate, entertainment and media, private equity and venture capital, and high-tech help build sustainable businesses and expand our associates’ potential for career advancement.
  

  

Headquartered in California, East West Bank (Nasdaq: EWBC) is a top performing commercial bank with an exclusive focus on the U.S. and Greater China markets. With a strong foundation, and enterprising spirit and a commitment to absolute integrity, East West Bank gives people the confidence to reach further.
Overview:

East West Bank is currently seeking a Portfolio Manager in Commercial Real Estate Group in NYC. This individual will be responsible for underwriting, credit monitoring and portfolio management for Commercial Real Estate Group. Primary performance responsibilities include analyzing financial data to determine the merits of loan requests, recommending structure.  

As an East West Bank employee, you will be part of a growing and stable organization that provides career path development opportunities while serving a growing and profitable market.
Responsibilities:
* Assisting Relationship Manager in underwriting and managing and structuring commercial real estate loans according to the Bank establish guidelines and policies
* Ongoing monitoring of credit/Covenant Compliance
* Analyze and create financial loan write-ups to generate new loans.
* Manage the renewal process by working with the Relationship Manager, the client and the credit department including increase/amendment/waiver
* Partner with the Relationship Manager as the point of contact for the client; acting as a liaison to the Credit Department, the Commercial support staff and other internal business partners
* Ensure compliance with EWB regulatory and credit requirements.
* Assist in accurately risk rating loans/credits.
* Develop problem loan credit solutions.
* Work with credit analyst in reviewing existing credits
* Ensure the portfolio administration and risk management of each client relationship is in compliance with established EWB credit policy, procedure and business strategy as well as commercial and regulatory guidelines.
* As appropriate to experience, co-manage commercial relationships by analyzing financial data to determine the merits of specific loan requests, and recommend structure as well as aggressively managing the client relationship
* Responsible for credit risk and quality of the portfolio.
* Assist with due diligence/analysis with new client relationships, opportunity memos as appropriate.
* Monitor loan repayment activities and financial condition of borrowing clients and take necessary action to collect past due accounts and ongoing repayment ability of all other accounts. May assume overall responsibility for the credit quality of the loan portfolio
* As appropriate with experience, assist in the development of junior bankers, credit analysts, and relationship associates.
* May make presentations on specific loans and participate in the bank's Loan Approval Process, recommending approval and appropriate structure of credits.
* Perform other administrative duties required for the maintenance of a portfolio of clients.
* Perform other duties and special projects as needed


Qualifications:
* Bachelor's degree or combination of education and directly related experience
* Ideally has 7-10 years of banking experience with a minimum of 5 years of direct portfolio management experience in commercial real estate.
* 3 -5 years experience in managing/mentoring is strongly desired.
* Demonstrates strong underwriting and projection skills
* Has strong understanding of credit policy and procedures and is able to accurately risk-rate loans/credits, evaluates both cash-flow and collateral-based loans/credits
* Develop problem loan credit solutions.
* Thrive for success and able to work under minimum supervision.


Compensation: The base pay range for this position is USD $70,000.00/Yr. - USD $150,000.00/Yr. Exact offers will be determined based on job-related knowledge, skills, experience, and location.

* Documents findings and plan of care in the patient's medical record.
* Consults with physician according to established standards, policies, procedures, and protocols.

* Participates in team meetings and conferences to enhance an interdisciplinary approach to care delivery.
* Maintains patient/employee confidentiality in the management of information.
